description: Great to serve as Finger Food at a Party, as an Entree or a Main Meal. Very economical to make, delicious to eat.
keywords: Fish dishes,Pescatarian,Soy free,Tree nut free,Sesame free,Dairy free,Peanut free
name: Potato Sweet Potato & Tuna Bites Recipe | Woolworths

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl, add potato and sweet potato, mash well, add remainder of ingredients except extra panko for crumbing and the oil.

Mix well until all ingredients are combined. Roll into small bite sized balls (the mixture should make about 20) roll in extra panko crumbs, making sure they are well coated. Place in fridge to chill down for 10 minutes.

Add oil to frypan to heat (I use a 26cm pan for this amount of oil). You will know when oil is the right temperature by dropping a crumb or two into the oil, if it starts to bubble, then it's good to go.

Cook the bites in the oil in two batches, as to not overcrowd the pan. Cook for about 5 minutes, for each batch, turning them often in the pan until cooked and golden in colour. Remove and drain on absorbent paper. Can serve on their own with a dipping sauce, or with homemade chips, or with a fresh garden salad or with a cold rice salad - the list is endless - Enjoy!
